title.narrative: FIELD OPERATIONS AND EMERGENCY

description.narrative: Field operations and emergency including Rapid Response Mechanism, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation And Research, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Effectiveness

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Field operations and emergency including Rapid Response Mechanism

description.narrative: UNICEF successfully responded to all the major new humanitarian situations and epidemics in 2019, and also supported return movements following the signing of a peace agreement. UNICEF's emergency response, spearheaded by the Rapid Response Mechanism (RRM), is becoming increasingly multi-sector, and is strengthened through stronger intersectoral coordination and collaboration between country and zonal offices. Emergency preparedness measures (EPP) are in place and an Emergency Committee is operational to ensure emergency response. UNICEF-led Nutrition, WASH and Education clusters as well as the Child Protection working group are operational. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
